entries.ef50a707c18d9241: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Accurate and natural translation. Correctly identifies 'cakka\u1e43va vahato pada\u1e43' as the wheel following the hoof."}
entries.490bc112dd18c094: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Accurate and fluent. Correctly translates 'ch\u0101y\u0101va anap\u0101yin\u012b' as the shadow not leaving the body."}
entries.7d09829ee1953ee5: {"accuracy": 2, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Incorrectly translates the first line as a command ('\u0110\u1eebng...') instead of a description of past grievances ('He abused me...')."}
entries.d208c9aa43952de3: {"accuracy": 2, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Same error as Item 3; misinterprets the past tense verbs as imperatives."}
entries.bb2d7f47e5f8b5c6: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate meaning, though the phrasing 'kh\u00f4ng th\u00f9 h\u1eadn' is slightly less poetic than 't\u1eeb bi' or 'kh\u00f4ng h\u1eadn'."}
entries.bcfe8e1a002daf89: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Misses the specific nuance of 'yam\u0101mase' (we are perishing/dying here) and repeats 'y\u00ean \u1ed5n' redundantly."}
entries.9d316d6545aafd2e: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Translates 'subh\u0101nupassi\u1e43' as 't\u00e1n t\u1ec9nh' (flirting/courting), which is a bit odd in a Buddhist context; 'qu\u00e1n t\u1ecbnh' is better."}
entries.76f8b388eae925fc: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Similar to Item 7, 't\u00e1n t\u1ec9nh' is an unusual choice for 'asubh\u0101nupassi\u1e43' (contemplating the foul)."}
entries.c1a64c46f6f1dea0: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate, though 'ch\u1ec9 che gi\u1ea5u b\u1eb1ng \u00e1o c\u00e0 sa' is an interpretive addition not explicitly in the Pali."}
entries.77defc349489f02f: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Accurate and clear translation of the qualities of one worthy of the robe."}
entries.f6001c8110412c5e: {"accuracy": 2, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Misinterprets 's\u0101ra' (essence/truth) as 'gi\u00e1 tr\u1ecb' (value/worth of people), changing the meaning from discerning truth to social status."}
entries.cc882b3a5341218c: {"accuracy": 2, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Same error as Item 11; treats 's\u0101ra' as a quality of people rather than the essence of reality/truth."}
entries.cd20c1be939b9258: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Translates 'vu\u1e6d\u1e6dh\u012b' (rain) as 'gi\u00f3' (wind). While the metaphor holds, it is technically inaccurate."}
entries.9de1cab0136d70cc: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Accurate and captures the repetitive structure of the Pali verse well."}
entries.105e75390170e64f: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate, though it contains a Chinese character '\u5584' instead of the Vietnamese word 'thi\u1ec7n'."}
entries.0d3b54d83d4ec384: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Accurate and fluent translation of the joy of the merit-maker."}
entries.6e0b3292667d4397: {"accuracy": 2, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Major errors: 'sahita\u1e43' refers to scriptures/texts, not 'cooperation'. 'S\u0101ma\u00f1\u00f1assa' refers to the ascetic life, not 'equality'."}
entries.d10b487cc97fffb1: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate meaning, but 't\u00e2m nhanh nh\u01b0 \u00fd' is a slight misinterpretation of 'manojav\u0101\u1e25' (mind-impelled/swift as mind) and 'b\u00e1nh xe theo ch\u00e2n ng\u1ef1a' adds 'horse' which isn't in the text (vahata\u1e25 refers to the ox/beast of burden)."}
entries.37b38f7d928bf825: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate translation of the positive counterpart to Item 1. Fluency is good, though slightly prose-heavy compared to the verse structure."}
entries.da342105b52051a3: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "The candidate misses the specific nuances of 'ayojan' (bound/oppressed) and 'aj\u0101payet' (conquered/robbed), generalizing them as 'ghen gh\u00e9t' (envy/jealousy)."}
entries.36cc4e1e4c8c9124: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "Similar to Item 3, it misses the specific verbs of the first half, though the second half correctly identifies the cessation of hatred."}
entries.fffb931dd3da9854: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate, but translating 'dharma' as 'ph\u00e1p lu\u1eadt' (secular law) is slightly less appropriate than '\u0111\u1ecbnh lu\u1eadt' or 'ph\u00e1p' in a Buddhist context."}
entries.3e2a93822be65a39: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 3, "explanation": "The translation of 'yam\u0101mahe' as 't\u1ef1 ki\u1ec1m ch\u1ebf' is one interpretation, but the candidate misses the nuance of 'medhak\u0101\u1e25' (quarrels/strife) at the end, translating it vaguely as 'an y\u00ean'."}
entries.02247372ece8825b: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Good accuracy. 'G\u1ea7n g\u0169i v\u1edbi \u0111i\u1ec1u t\u1ed1t \u0111\u1eb9p' for '\u015aubh\u0101nupa\u015by\u012b' (contemplating the pleasant) is slightly off; it usually refers to focusing on attractive aspects that trigger lust."}
entries.e11a0f99bc9d0642: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 2, "explanation": "Contains a Chinese character error ('\u4e0d\u597d') in the Vietnamese text. 'A\u015bubh\u0101nupa\u015by\u012b' means contemplating the unattractive/impurity, not just 'bad things'."}
entries.986cfbfcec326a7d: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Translates 'ani\u1e63ka\u1e63\u0101ya\u1e25' (not free from impurities) as 'kh\u00f4ng c\u00f3 l\u00f2ng t\u1eeb bi' (no compassion), which is a thematic leap rather than a literal translation."}
entries.623283534a86c707: {"accuracy": 3, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Similar to Item 9, it replaces 'purity from stains' and 'self-restraint' with 'compassion' and 'humility', which are not the direct meanings of the Sanskrit terms."}
entries.36962b8ef19e11f9: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Excellent translation. Captures the essence of 's\u0101ra' (essence/value) and 'as\u0101ra' (non-essence) very clearly in natural Vietnamese."}
entries.868f6ac88dd2a4b5: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 5, "explanation": "Consistent with Item 11, providing a clear and accurate contrast between essence and non-essence."}
entries.47abf0be759ce953: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate. 'Kh\u00f4ng c\u00f3 m\u00e1i che' is slightly different from 'duchanna\u1e43' (badly thatched), but the metaphor remains intact."}
entries.fb8db820be4880b3: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate and clear. Good parallel to Item 13."}
entries.95a5960d2da279ee: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate translation of the Sanskrit '\u015bocati' (grieves/sorrows) and the realization of one's own defiled actions."}
entries.a8fb5624542aa6c5: {"accuracy": 5, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate translation of the joy resulting from pure actions."}
entries.5f5f76e2a93ede9e: {"accuracy": 1, "fluency": 1, "explanation": "The candidate failed to provide a translation."}
entries.dec603198926554f: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Good translation of the 'cowherd' metaphor. 'Sahita\u1e43' usually refers to scriptures/texts, which 'n\u00f3i nhi\u1ec1u' captures generally."}
entries.ebd856d8dbc75ae0: {"accuracy": 4, "fluency": 4, "explanation": "Accurate. Captures the essence of practicing according to the Dhamma despite knowing little."}
